page.title: 16REGIMENTAL HQ & MUSEUM
page.content: Gordon Highlander's Regimental HQ & museum. The Gordon Highlander's museum is in the grounds of the Regimental HQ in Viewfield Road. The original building was erected in 1850 as a farmhouse in the grounds of Kepplehills estate. The famous artist, Sir George Reid, bought the house, which is now a listed building, in 1900 and added a studio which is now the museum. The regiment, whose motto is "Bydand"(meaning Stand Fast)was raised in 1794 and has had a distinguished career in many parts of the world gaining many honours including several VCs. In the museum is a hand loom,made by a prisoner of war, which can produce kilts. The battalion, whose Colonel in Chief is H.R.H. The Prince of Wales, is at present garrisoned at Honer in West Germany.
